thread.title: Report: Miami Marlins interested in Don Mattingly
thread.title_full: Report: Miami Marlins interested in Don Mattingly - UPI.com

author: upi.com
title: Report: Miami Marlins interested in Don Mattingly
text:
| License Photo Former Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly is considered the top candidate for the managerial opening with the Miami Marlins.
The Miami Herald reported Friday that there is mutual interest between Mattingly and the Marlins. Mattingly and the Dodgers parted ways last week after losing a National League Division Series with the New York Mets.
According to the Herald, the Marlins will begin discussions with Mattingly in the next few days. The club has already interviewed Phil Nevin, Manny Acta , Bo Porter, Alex Cora , Rick Renteria and Larry Bowa .
The 54-year-old Mattingly compiled a 446-363 record in five seasons with the Dodgers.
Mattingly was a six-time All-Star and the 1985 American League MVP during his 14-year playing career with the New York Yankees.
  Yankees name Mattingly hitting coach Mattingly no longer Dodgers' hitting coach Dodgers, Manager Don Mattingly agree on contract extension Clarification of Dan Jennings' role with Miami Marlins coming soon
